ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Yes I would recommend it. It is a very useful introductory course to critically reading research papers.
yes, it teaches you how to read and evaluate work that is not in your field

a very good course that helps you learn to read, think, talk, and write about science. I would definitely recommend this course to a student interested in science because it teaches very essential skills and is also great fun to be a part of.
On a per hour basis, I did the most learning of my semester in this course. I would absolutely recommend it.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: Incredible, I learned a whole ton about a lot of stuff that I'm sure will be helpful to know. I'd love to TA the course just to see a new set of lecturers.I already reviewed this course in an email evaluation.

the course helped me practice skills in reading current scientific articles, reasoning about science, and writing in a clear manner. these will be essential skills to have for my research and future scientific career.
The course broadened more than deepened my knowledge. It was most helpful in terms of getting me thinking about how to design experiments.
